The mind-tingling science of HPS Brain Gym™

It’s not rocket science, it’s neuroscience. And we’ve been thinking and working in this area for decades.

Disclaimer:This page may cause brain stimulation.
In a good way.

The HPS Brain Gym™ has been created by healthcare professionals, with decades of experience in psychology, psychiatry and neuroscience. We’ve distilled years of research and clinical practice into this program.

Our solution is an integrated one, with a foundation in evidence-based psychological tools. This approach promotes adaptive coping to create positive changes in the structure and function of the brain, all the while buffering the brain from the negative effects of stress.

Our network of trained HPS Brain Gym™ Coaches provides face-to-face and online coaching, combined with an integrated digital platform for connection and further learning. Your brain is constantly on. Now you can rely on the right support to always be there too.

Our head of brain health

Jim Hudziak, MD is the co-founder and creator of the HPS Brain Gym™. After over 30 years of scientifically testing and implementing health promotion, illness prevention, and intervention strategies for brain health, he created this program to bring the knowledge and skills to build healthier brains to the workplace.

What makes us different?

Each brain is unique. Our human coaches, teamed with Brain Gym Connect, are trained to meet everyone where they're at. Our full suite of integrated products makes our users feel understood, supported, guided, and educated in the science of how to train their brains.

We care what people think

Here’s what other people and businesses who have tried us have to say.

“The best program I have ever put into place for my team. Even in four-weeks we were all functioning better as individuals but more importantly as a team. The beauty of Brain Gym is it is easy, simple and actually works!”

Stephanie Pronk Former Senior Vice President, National Health Transformation Team Leader, AON

“The pandemic has really highlighted how important humans are to businesses and that it’s not always about profits first. You might see more of a balance in a lot of organizations between people and profits, recognizing that if people are not healthy and well, that profits aren’t going to come along”

Stephanie Pronk Former Senior Vice President, National Health Transformation Team Leader, AON

“You can see warning signs much better when you’re face-to-face with someone. That’s been one of the challenges and that will continue to be a challenge.”

Stephanie Pronk Former Senior Vice President, National Health Transformation Team Leader, AON

The brains behind HPS Brain Gym™

Meet our team of brain health experts who bring the HPS Brain Gym™ to life.

Meet Jim

Jim Hudziak, M.D., is a Clinician Scientist in the field of neuropsychiatry who has spent over 30 years practicing brain health promotion, illness prevention, and intervention strategies. He is known internationally for his work on the impact of the environment, genetics and epigenetics on brain development and health. He has over 250 peer-reviewed publications on his research in children, families, college students, medical students, and members of the corporate workforce. He has developed widely known health promotion and intervention programs to teach others about the relationship between their habits, behaviors, and their brain health.

Meet Masha

Masha Ivanova, Ph.D., is a Licensed Clinical Psychologist with decades of clinical and research experience. Dr. Ivanova received her Ph.D. from the University at Albany, and completed her advanced clinical and research training at the University of Vermont and the University of Vermont Medical Center. Her research examines how family and cultural influences affect emotional and behavioral health and well-being across the lifespan.

Meet Azilee

Azilee Curl, B.S. (Neuroscience), is a Clinical Researcher and Project Manager who helps to research, develop, and promote health-promotion programs. Her research includes the neurobiology of Autism Spectrum Disorder, population well-being in university and medical school settings, and the biochemical measurements of sleep and emotions. She has developed multiple apps that use applied neuroscience to monitor and promote well-being behaviors.
